results.title: Impasse
results.brief_description: An experimental animated film, dedicated to Elfriede and Oskar Fischinger, which involves the use of Avery labels to produce graphic designs. No dialogue, musical soundtrack.

results.title: Imogen Cunningham, photographer
results.brief_description: A fascinating insight into the life and works of photographer Imogen Cunningham. Coming into public attention around 1910, she was celebrated in the late sixties through awards, honorary degrees and exhibitions. Her photos are looked at from three focal points: nature, portraits and figure studies.

results.title: Immunization. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: The external symptoms of disease, and how disease affects the blood-stream, are shown; immunity may be obtained from a disease either by contracting it and surviving, thus gaining (usually) active immunization; or by vaccination, which provides passive immunity, is just as effective, and does not endanger life. Second edition version.

results.title: Immigration law: a delicate balance
results.creator_credit: Arnie Gelbart, Joseph Koenig and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The immigration law, and its enforcement, are examined in this documentary. It is a difficult exercise in which objective and non discriminatory criteria are applied in the screening of each prospective new Canadian. Case histories illustrate various aspects of this law.

results.title: Immigration
results.brief_description:
How the USA has been populated during the last two centuries. For many reasons people left the Old World to try their luck in the Americas - all have found a home in the USA during the past 200 years.
No credits available.

results.title: Immemory
results.brief_description:
Marker charts a haunting journey through memory, cinema, photography, war and literature tracing an itinerary or map of an imaginary country. This voyage takes us from the “Madeline” at the intersection of Proust and Hitchcock through an archive of image and text that culminates as a self-portrait.

(Electonic Arts Intermix)

results.title: Imitation of life [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Douglas Sirk, Ross Hunter and Universal International Pictures
results.brief_description: Two widows, a rising actress and her African-American housekeeper, struggle in their relationships with their troubled daughters. As the years pass, each of the four women realises that she has been living out an emotionally fruitless existence. A film in which the conventions of the ‘woman’s weepie’ are manipulated in a melodramatic schema of American class and race relations. An ironic success story, the rise of Lora (Lana Turner) from housewife to actress, in the first half, merges into intensified melodrama on the theme of race and identity as a light skinned black woman tries to pass as white. Based on the novel by Fannie Hurst. Cast also includes John Gavin, Juanita Moore, Robert Alda, Susan Kohner and Sandra Dee.
